discourse_list.title: DAI should peg to a basket of world currencies

content.content: Dev team should really start thinking about Dia tracking an index of the worlds currencies instead of just the dollar. Look at what is happening with the USD right now. The ten year keeps tracking up and the fed is not really doing much to stop it. The dollar is slowly losing ground as the worlds reserve currency as well as the US is losing the number 1 GDP spot. What is wrong with at least developing a contingency plan to transition to a multi-currency index tracking Dai if needed? Or maybe just give us the choice between several different Dai all tracking different major currencies? Seems to me the the idea of a stablecoin would be most stable if it tracked a more decentralized network of currencies instead of just one.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes that DAI should track an index of world currencies instead of just the dollar, to ensure stability. The post suggests developing a contingency plan to transition to a multi-currency index tracking DAI if needed, or giving users the choice between several different DAI all tracking different major currencies. The post also questions the idea of a stablecoin tracking just one currency.

content.content: Actually it was originally supposed to be pegged to the SDR. This was abaonded for two primary reasons: (1) No one wants to borrow in a currency they can’t actually use. Most things are denominated in USD and that’s what borrowers want as their unit of account. (2) Since everything is priced in USD (damn petrodollar!), the SDR is more often than not less stable than the USD relative to baskets of goods and services

content.content: Note that in the future, when there are other currencies such as eurDAI and perhaps more such variants, it will be quite easy to create a wrapper token that gives you a basket of them and rebalances periodically. It is also probably a lot easier to have oracles for actual currencies than some index.
